docs.lead_paragraph: ST.LOUIS, March 19 -- Two arguments in behalf of the Wabash Railroad were concluded to-day in the injunction proceeding before United States District Judge Adams, and the first statement in behalf of the men was begun by F.M. Judson of St. Louis. The case will certainly continue throughout to-morrow, and possibly throughout Saturday, no restriction having been placed by Judge Adams upon the length of arguments.

headline.main: STRIKE WRIT ARGUMENT; Both Sides Heard in the Wabash Injunction Suit. Judge Adams Shows Interest in the Contentions of the Counsel for the Unions.
